item.title: Leslie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Cicero
item.description: "If you have a garden and a library, you have everything you need." -- Cicero

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Leslie add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace." -- John Lennon

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it." -- Aristotle

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Angry people are not always wise." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The future depends on what you do today." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Leslie add a quote by Martin Niemöller
